programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: Learn the fascinating story of how 12 surprising forces have shaped human civilisation, helping to form the world of today.

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: Learn the fascinating story of how 12 surprising forces have shaped human civilisation, helping to form the world of today.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The story of a UFO crashing in Roswell is the most famous case in UFO history. Now, a theory has emerged that there was more than one crash site.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Ancient Discoveries
programme.desc: Ancient Discoveries travels to the farthest corners of the ancient East to uncover weapons never before seen by the world at large. Experts investigate how armour that could stop arrows was made of nothing more than paper.

programme.title: Ancient Top 10
programme.desc: Ancient Top 10 is a smart, fun countdown that details how ancient technology worked, how surprisingly advanced it was, and how it was kind of awesome!

programme.title: Rome: Rise And Fall Of An Empire
programme.desc: As Emperor of Spain, Gaul and Britain, Constantine proved himself as a leader and changed western civilisation forever, turning the empire towards Christianity.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: From plague victims being buried alive, to body snatchers, illegal distilleries and castle dungeons, Edinburghs underground world has many stories to tell.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: ‘The Universe’ examines how we know what we do about space; Mars, black holes and even if there is anywhere else out there that can sustain human life. This is the story of the scientists and explorers who dared to venture into uncharted territory.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: In major cities around the world today, skyscrapers loom overhead, taxis honk their horns and street vendors peddle their wares. But below lies city upon city. ‘Cities of the Underworld’ explores this fascinating and unknown history.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved
programme.desc: This mini-series looks into the history and beliefs behind religions that have shaped the universe. The show unearths alternative suggestions, poses questions and challenges the accepted, opening a whole new world on the history of the universe.

programme.title: The Curse Of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: Alex Lagina joins Kevin Dykstra and his team in their quest to find 140 million dollars in Confederate gold they believe is on the bottom of Lake Michigan and on their first day back on the lake, new evidence suggests they may have found it.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team from UFO Magazine open their files and investigate UFO cases around the world. Using eyewitness accounts, scientific experimentation and incredible footage, they piece together compelling evidence of UFO phenomena.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Rome: Rise And Fall Of An Empire
programme.desc: 113 BC. Rome is a small empire on the edge of the Mediterranean. After several disastrous defeats, the Roman elite are forced to turn to a commoner, Marius, to shake up the army and save Rome!

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigate the facts and myths surrounding UFO sightings in every corner of the world. Examine evidence and eyewitness accounts and explore the mystery of what happened or what didnt happen.

programme.title: Project Impossible
programme.desc: Above the arctic circle, projects are underway that are opening up the Arctic to the rest of the world. On this episode: building a nuclear-powered icebreaker in Russia; and constructing a modern airport on Baffin Island.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is fascinated that his friend Little Grey Squirrel is going to stay in his dray all Winter long. He and Little Field Mouse decide to hibernate in the hollow log until Spring, but soon become bored and fidgety. Little Field Mouse gives up and plays in the snow. Will Little Nutbrown Hare manage to stay inside, or will he be tempted out as well?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After a long quiet winter in the meadow Little Nutbrown hare announces that he can’t wait for winter to be over so he can enjoy the other seasons with their special treats to see, hear and taste. Will the sound of icicles tinkling in the wind, the taste of a frozen Winter berry and some very unusual tracks in the snow convince the little hare that Winter is just as special as the other seasons?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Discover new words and join in the activities with Timmy and his friends in this fun learning series developed by Aardman and the British Council, world expects in teaching English.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Peppino delivers pizzas faster than anyone in Busytown, so when the kids wait an unusually long time for their pizza to arrive, they figure something must be wrong at the pizzeria. But Peppino isnt there and neither is his delivery car. By following his delivery route, the kids ultimately find Peppino stuck in an elevator./‘Fairy dust’ and strange sightings has Hilda Hippo convinced there are real live fairies in Busytown Woods!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is sniffing around his sitting room trying to find out what smells so bad... Eurghh fresh laundry - Messy can’t stand this clean smell! In fact its smelly socks that smell delicious to a Messy monster! Why do some socks smell good and some bad? It’s off to Okido to find out! Felix and Zoe are outside in Okido, holding their noses against a terrible smell in the air. The smell is so terrible that Lolly thinks it’s the flowers Mayor Oki gave to her.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is in the laundry basket, hurling socks around the bathroom. “Green, my favourite! But I wonder what makes green socks green?” He vortexes himself to Okido to find out. When Messy lands in Okido, Felix and Zoe are in the garden beating the dirt out of their tent. Dust billows out in clouds as Messy helps them, but it’s still covered in dirt. Zam asks if they need any help, because she has just the thing!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When a comedy of errors causes Orange, Plum and Cherry to arrive late to their campout, they start off their annual tradition of telling tall-tales around the campfire by making up three outrageous, hysterical accounts of what held them up.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry accidentally smashes his mums favourite china teacup.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry needs help making up a story to go with his new drawing.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah discovers a mysterious jar containing a sparkly squid while cleaning her dirt bike at a Singaporean beach. Meanwhile, in the Hero Garden, Katie initiates a complex treasure hunt for Leo that ends with an unexpected twist—a new map inside a treasure chest. The rangers receive an emergency call from Farah, who finds the squid changing colors inside the jar. Concerned for the squids well-being, they consult the computer, and identifies the squid as a Bigfin Reef Squid. The team rushes to the beach, where Leo accidentally throws the jar into the ocean in an attempt to open it. They try to grab the jar into the ocean but to no avail when suddenly Ranger Rocky grabs it from underwater! They retrieve the jar but find the squid in a seemingly lifeless state. Ranger Joeys insights reveal that the squid is likely in shock and needs a dark, cool environment to recover. The rangers transport the squid to the ocean floor near a coral reef, witnessing its vibrant transformation and ensuring it finds a safe home. Back in the Treehouse, Leo hangs a photo of the Bigfin Reef Squid, and in the Garden, Katie gets frustrated as all the treasure chests she finds only have been full of maps.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is working on the Indian Railway and Charubala rewards him for always being early by giving him a very important job - delivering some precious silk to a famous fashion designer. But when Thomas sees swimming elephants on his journey, he gets so excited that he misses his turning and delivers the silk to the wrong station without realizing. Instead of listening to Ashimas advice and telling Charubala, Thomas attempts to sort out his mistake alone. He ends up getting himself into even more trouble by picking up the wrong cars/trucks, not listening to Noor Jehans warnings and continuing to not tell Charubala about the big mess he has caused. Finally he owns up to his mistakes and everyone helps him put things right!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas thinks that Raul the Brazilian tank engine is fun because he turns every boring task into a game.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu has to look after Thingy while his mistress Olivia is away. Grisu has to take the dog to the pet grooming shop to take a bath. But Thingy is a stubborn dog. He refuses to move forward. Grisu And Stella will have to use kindness and to be smart enough to drive the dog through the town. Without listening to his father Fume, who tries to make him use his dragon flame...

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The shooting of the movie “The monster of the Valley”, directed by the famous Quintin Ratatino, is going badly. A fire has destroyed his mechanical monster and his film crew has deserted the scene. Grisu and Stella help to save the movie. Grisu takes on the role of the monster and Stella helps with the technique. But playing the main part in a Ratatino’s movie is not that easy, evenmore when the director asks Grisu to play the role... of a nasty dragon!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Chilly Autumn winds blow as Little Nutbrown Hare chases the beautiful fallen leaves. When one wafts so high that only a bird could catch it Little Nutbrown Hare wishes he could fly as well. He and Little Field Mouse try every way they can think of to fly, without luck. They have fun trying, however, and along the way they discover they have their own very special talents.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Crisp Autumn days are perfect for collecting pretty golden leaves and playing hide and boo. Little Nutbrown Hare is so excited that he accidently promises to play with two different games with two different friends on the same day. He can’t be in two places at once, so how will he keep both his promises and both his friends happy?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees try for their ‘Keep Chuggington Beautiful’ badges by thinking of ways to make their city more attractive. Koko’s going to wash down platforms using the firecar and Brewster’s going to repaint some fences using the paintcar. Wilson decides to do some litter-picking – but a stowaway monkey makes things a bit difficult for him! In the end, the monkey helps Wilson in his task and Chuggington is left even more beautiful!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger, Woodsy and Rosie are about to celebrate the winter solstice according to the fox tradition: they spend the longest night of the year awake, and the whole family has fun. The foxes’ tradition is wholly different from that of the badgers, who celebrate the winter solstice by going to bed very early, to make the most of the longest sleep of the year. Yet, Edmunddecides that badgers and foxes are each going to follow their own tradition, separately.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team arrive at the Racetrack to build three horse stables the day before a big race. At the sight of the horses, Leo goes into ‘cowboy mode’ for the duration of the build. Henry Corner, the anxious groom, wants the build to be as noise-free as possible for the sake of his nervy horses, which is exactly when the noisy Two-Tonne arrives in reverse. The build progresses well, until, getting carried away lassoing with some spare ropes, Leo scares the horses, who escape from their paddock and kick out at the nearly-built stables in their excitement. The stables collapse like dominos! Bob and Scoop have to round up the horses now galloping around the racetrack while Wendy’s quick thinking and Lofty’s help steers them back safely into their paddock. But the stables still need to be built all over again and now it’s nearly dusk. A contrite Leo thinks he may have a solution, but what?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Roland’s Gifts is an internet gift shop; Bob, Leo, Scoop, Muck and Lofty are in its huge distrubution warehouse with owner, Roland Sweet. It’s a few days before Christmas and Roland has commissioned Bob and his team to install a hi-tech a robotic picking system, which will pick items off shelving, wrap them and put them into delivery vans via a chute. The system needs to be installed by evening the next day so customers receive their gifts in time for Christmas Day. Scoop and Muck are excited and do ‘robotic’ impressions; Leo claims to be very knowledgeable about robotics. During the installation Leo switches the system on to prove his knowledge to Scoop. Meanwhile an approaching snowstorm has moved the delivery deadline to that very evening.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and his pals all receive party invitations, but the partys location is a mystery. Small circular marks left behind by whoever delivered the invitations are an important clue. It leads Huckle and pals to Miss Honey whos been walking with a crutch. Grateful for the help she got raking up all her leaves, Miss Honey decided to throw a party for all the volunteers./Huckle and his pals discover a mysterious gigantic spoon.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A fun game of table tennis leads to the surprise discovery of a baby sea turtle and some sea turtle eggs! Can the Junior Rangers return the baby sea turtle and eggs to the beach while keeping them safe from hungry raccoons?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a greater mouse-deer back to its home in the rainforest. But can the Junior Rangers rescue the mouse-deer when it gets caught in an animal trap?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: When Simon overhears Daddy and Mummy talking about a surprise during a game of Hide and Seek, he and Gaspard decide to search everywhere in the house in order to find it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanley, the stag beetle, and his friends excitedly try out the new traffic park, practicing the rules of the road with roller skates, scooters, bicycles, and small motorcycles. However, Balthazar, the bee, ignores the signs and causes a minor accident by driving recklessly. With the help of the Queen Ant, the little friends learn traffic rules and signs so they can play safely and happily together.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In the fall, the chimney sweep smoke beetle visits the forest friends to clean their chimneys. In Patricks chimney, he finds a shiny hair clip that turns out to be a gift Dolly sent to Katie via Pigeon Post. The friends solve the mystery together, and Katie finally receives the shiny hair clip.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends are picking apples when an old steam locomotive appears on the hill. At the request of the scarlet beetle train engineer, the little friends help repair the locomotive and paint the wagons in bright colors. The cinnabar beetle thanks them by taking them on a special train trip to the great waterfall. The friends enjoy the journey and have a fun day together. At the end of the trip, they happily return home with the colorful train.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly goes for a walk, and finally she is enriched with a beautiful cherry and a good friend.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry becomes sad because he can not climb on the rainbow but Dolly makes him happy with an exceptionally creative present.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are building a sandcastle when Pando joins them in the sandpit with his wind-up digger toy to help. Bing finds a lovely ‘poiky thing’ in the sand and thinks it will make the perfect decoration for the top of his castle not realizing it belongs to Pando’s digger.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula collect acorns in the park with Flop, but Bings pile keeps shrinking.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop is feeling poorly so Bing decides to look after him. When Bing tries to make Flop a honey-lemon drink he ends up making a big mess instead.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Edna asks Rupert to look after her sons Billy and Benny. No problem, thinks Rupert. They can play while he reads a book. But no sooner has Rupert sat down in his armchair than the little squirrels turn up with one request after another. First they want lunch, then they need to go to the loo, then they want to play.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is a clever and intelligent mouse who lives in a tiny house at the base of the church wall with her pet Snaily and her best friends.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is visited by her Great Great Aunt Emily. In honour of the occasion, all the friends have a game of Blind Mans Buff. Emily and Rupert have to take off their glasses. After the game, the two pairs of spectacles get mixed up and Emily and Rupert suddenly start suffering all manner of mishap: Rupert bites into an onion instead of an apple...

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon, Lou and Ferdinand are happy to see each other again after the Christmas holiday. They all got super presents. Lou has even brought to school a soccer ball she got for Christmas and they all start playing. Simon does a series of super shots and Lou does a brilliant header! The bell rings and they take a break to go back into class. It’s drawing period. Simon is drawing a portrait of Lou and Lou notices that he drew her with only one barrette. Argh, she’s missing the other one! Oh no, she must have dropped it in the school yard!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Join the Junior Rangers as they race across the tundra to reunite a lost reindeer calf with its herd. However, a river crossing might prove too tiring for the young reindeer.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out playing in the forest, T’choupi and Nina come across a broken bird’s egg. Wooow! Look at that: a little chick has literally just been born! But wait a minute: this particular egg is blue, and as far as they know, birds don’t lay blue eggs… Could it be from another type of animal?? And if so, which one? Super excited, T’choupi and Nina start searching for the mysterious creature that laid this blue egg…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today, T’choupi and his friends, Nina and Luce, must help Fred take his goats to a field a certain distance away. But when Loupiote the dog gets wounded and is unable to shepherd the goats, the kids are very disappointed. Until, all of a sudden, they get a brilliant idea: why don’t they stand in for Loupiote and play shepherd dog, to guide the goat herd to the grazing field?...!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi and Nina find out there’s going to be a star shower visible in the sky tonight, they get very excited, and determined not to miss it! But they’re going to have to persuade their parents in order for that to happen… Not an easy feat: they’re way too young to stay up so late…

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Its the end of the year and the school needs tidying up. Paulie is dragging his feet at the thought of having to sort everything out - hed rather carry on playing! But when Medhi tells them that theyre going to send the equipment thats still in good condition to a school at the end of the world that lacks everything, what used to be a chore turns into an exciting task! The children are going to put all their heart and soul into the success of this wonderful undertaking!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia realizes that, despite her efforts to fit in, she will never share all the memories the children have made living in the Mouse Mansion. Sam will help her overcome this difficulty.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia dream of seeing snow falling in the yard of the Mouse Mansion. They decide to do everything they can to make this happen. But such a thing is not so simple, as they will find out!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas and Edward decide to teach Gordon a lesson after he refuses to thank Edward for rescuing him from Gordon Hill, despite previously berating the smaller engine for being old and unreliable.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Annie and Clarabel are always complaining to Thomas about going too fast. Thomas likes to tease them, by going too fast or too slow (so Annie and Clarabel will ask him to go faster again). But when Annie and Clarabel find themselves coupled to Caitlin by mistake, they get a taste of what going fast is really like, and poor Thomas gets frightened that they might be taken to the mainland forever.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou tries skateboarding again after falling the first time!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: What a drama, Monkey’s twig boat drifted away in to the lake. Monkey was sure it was gone when his friend Duck saved the day and brought it back to shore. Of course seeing duck in action gave Monkey a brilliant idea, that they play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: What would be a better place for Monkey’s precious treasure then in the pouch of his best friend the Kangaroo? Kangaroo not only agrees to keep the treasure, he is also willing to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”! The whole savanna shakes as kangaroo shows Monkey and the children how to jump, move their hands and check their pouches just like kangaroos. Jump aboard and some hot savanna fun!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Tom Thomas tries to help the Pioneers earn their bird watching badges using a fancy new APP, his phone obsession causes him to tumble over a cliff! Without Tom to fly the helicopter, it’s up to a mysterious new character to save the day…

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah is excited to shadow Sergeant Rose Ravani until she gets stuck filing maps. But when Gareth and Nipper go missing in the woods, Rose leads their rescue mission

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When Franklin emulates Mr. Heron and plays “post-turtle” for all his friends, he accidentally misplaces (and doesn’t deliver) a special drawing that Beaver made for Goose. It’s only when he accepts his responsibility in the mess-up, that he feels better about it. /Franklin and his friends make a get-well card for Snail but when Franklin carelessly leaves it on his window ledge, it falls into the road and gets caught up in the wind. Enlisting the help of all his friends to chase the card through a blustery Woodland day, Franklin tries to avoid telling them how it got lost in the first place. But it ends up feeling better to tell the truth.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: In the morning, Rosie discovers that its Grandparents Day,which she had totally forgotten! But Grandpa and Grandma Fox are coming for dinner and she is intent on making a gift for them. She decides to create a show with the help of her sister, her brothers and Edmund. It will be The Three Little Badgers. Alas, nothing goes as Rosie hoped. The show is soon at risk, as Edmund, who was supposed to play the Big Bad Hurricane mustleave to help Casimir fix a collapsed dam.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky loves snow and he would like to see how it forms in the clouds. Doodleboo knows a great way to visit them.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky claims not to be afraid of big animals or water. Animals, water? Doodleboo challenges him to find out which big animal has thick skin and loves water.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is too greedy! He cannot help eating too fast. Doodleboo shows him that he should follow the example of someone who likes to take his time.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave make up a song of jungle animal noises. Listening carefully to the sounds their jungle friends make, they learn how to ‘Oooh-Oooh-ooh’ like a monkey, ‘kaw’ like a parrot and ‘roar’ like a Leopard - and everyone joins them in singing their special Jungle Song!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave learn different ways to stay safe. Hatty shows them how to be safe when crossing a road, boating and doing construction work. Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help keep others safe too, when they repair a broken road sign to warn the Sheep about danger on the road up ahead!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The series follows a warm father-son relationship that Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants a clever long tail like his friends, rather than a short fluffy one. They help out by making him a long tail but all the results are either too tickly, bendy or flappy. When Big Nutbrown Hare spots his son from way across a grassy field everyone realizes that Little Nutbrown Hare’s little tail is clever in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Summer’s day Little Field Mouse is very excited to show Little Nutbrown Hare her new favourite thing, a very pretty flower… the prettiest ever! She lets Little Nutbrown Hare borrow it to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but when it blows away during the night Little Nutbrown Hare worries how his friend will react. Will he be able to work up the courage to tell her what happened?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Trying to keep cool on a sticky Summer’s day by the stream, Little Nutbrown Hare and Big Nutbrown Hare have lots of fun skipping stones and throwing sticks. When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that sticks float, the two follow the sticks down the river to see where they go. It’s not an easy chase, and there is a surprise around every corner. Where will the sticks end up?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but it’s so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing loves Arlo the cat. They are friends. Bing strokes the kitty and they play hide and seek, but what happens when Bing meets a cat that isnt as friendly?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, plays beautifully on his violin for the forest inhabitants, but one day, no one listens to his new piece. First, he looks for Berry, Balthazar, and Stanley, but they are busy. He goes to Dolly, but she doesn’t have time either. Very discouraged, he decides to leave the forest. However, he meets the Magpie, who welcomes him and cheers him up. Meanwhile, the others begin to search for Alfonso. When they find him, they apologize and invite him to play his new piece at the playground opening.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One autumn day, Reggie Squirrel is visited by his old friend, Otto Badger, who brings a frisbee as a gift. They happily play with it, and when they head home, the frisbee falls at the base of a tree. Later, Berry and his friends find it and play with it, but Balthazar throws it so far that the frisbee vanishes. Reggie Squirrel asks them about it later, but Balthazar denies having seen it. Dolly and Flutter find the frisbee and bring it back to Reggie. Berry, feeling ashamed, admits that they accidentally threw the frisbee and couldnt find it. In the end, they all play happily with it until dark, carefully making sure not to throw it too far.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The Pig Twins discover a puddle full of stranded goldfish. Huckle and his pals try to solve the mystery of where they came from. It turns out they were blasted out of the park fountain when an obstruction in the drain hole suddenly got unplugged./ A mysterious message on Sgt. Murphy’s radio has Huckle and the gang baffled!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is trying to rest when deflating balloons whiz by and we see monkey trying unsuccessfully to inflate balloons. Mole appears and tells them of how the puffer fish knows inflates like a balloon. Under the ocean Monkey sees Puffer fish inflated but when Parrot looks at the fish its deflated until finally they both see him and invite him to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Norman and new boy Peter get lost at sea, Krystyna must pilot the new rescue plane and save them before their ship sinks!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Peter fixes Joe’s giant kite and gets it off the ground… unfortunately he also gets his feet tangled up in the string and is pulled into the air!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to make lemonade that both looks and tastes great. But when some of her preparations fall apart, it’s up to Kate to show her that things don’t have to be perfect to be great.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is sad when he learns that Plume the rabbit has hurt her paw. He and Nina decide to take their little furry friend into T’choupi’s bedroom: she’ll be safe in there and able to get a good rest while they take good care of her. T’choupi’s certain this is a good solution. But little does he know… cheeky little Plume has other ideas…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: It’s Father’s Day today. But neither T’choupi nor Nina can come up with a good idea for a special present for their respective dads. Benedicte suggests they gather up various objects from the forest and make drawings with them, on the ground. Great idea… except land art turns out to be a bit more complicated than they expected. And, more importantly, are their dads even going to like it?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Tonight there is a children show for the parents. Julia planned a scooter act with Sam. But Sam doesnt dare to tell her he is very bad on those wheels. How long can he avoid to tell her the truth?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: To help his little brother Ben feel less frustrated by his young age, Sam decided to help him. Together with Julia, they try to come up with a good scheme to make him feel like a hero.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly is excited for her friend Mings visit and to show her favourite spot. However, Ming keeps getting distracted. Molly eventually goes alone, but Ming finds her, and the picnic can finally begin.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are fascinated by the story of Aladdin and his wonderful lamp. If only they too could find a genie that would fulfill their wishes! Girl has an idea: she is convinced that Mom has a magic lamp and rushes to the kitchen to grab the gravy boat…that does look a lot like a genie lamp. But now how will they make it work? The Triplets are going to test various techniques with Eliott’s help, who also has a special wish: to not have to finish the dishes!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Girl would like to play doctor, but her two brothers are not in the mood: « play on your own! We won’t always be together you know? », Turbulent told her. « Not always together »? Girl is quite upset about that and decides to find a solution. How about all working in the same hospital later on? But the children disagree on who will get to drive the ambulance. Luckily, Mom has a solution so that the three of them can stay, together forever!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Its the first day of summer, which badgers celebrate and call Happy Poppy Day. Edmund wants to prepare Yolanda’s delicacies, a sweet specialty, which Scoutbadger, Woodsy and Berry’s mother used to bake on that day using poppy flowers. To make these delicacies, you need poppies, the recipe and thecontainers in which they should be served…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and the Super Friends use their powers to save their ball from the Master Thief!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou faces a fierce dragon that tries to steal his spaghetti!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Philip spots Toby and assumes that he is a diesel boxcab just like him. Convinced that they will become best friends, Philip rushes up to introduce himself, but Toby finds him rather overwhelming. Philip is very persistent and manages to get Toby to have a race with him, but Toby doesn’t like it very much. Philip gets upset and thinks Toby doesn’t like him, but with a little help he eventually learns that you can be friends with someone who doesn’t like the same things you like.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Brewster is going to be carrying Mayor Pullman, the new Mayoress of Chuggington, across the newly re-opened Border Bridge in the traditional welcoming ceremony. During the practise run, some of the facade falls off one of the bridge’s pillars. It looks as though the ceremony will have to be cancelled, as the bridge might not be safe! At first Brewster is devastated - but then he saves the day by using something Dr. Ling’s been working on: her new soap was a disaster in the chugwash, as it set into rock hard foam, but it’s perfect for repairing the bridge!

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: The new Mayoress, accompanied by her nephew Denzil, is touring Chuggington. She’s observing the chuggers working, in order to help her decide who should be the recipient of the prestigious Chugger of the Year award. Koko is sure she’s in with a chance - but rather than doing her jobs, she spends her time trying to impress the Mayoress. In the process, she ends up nearly ruining the ceremony. Speedy comes to her rescue time after time. In the end, Koko realises that she hasn’t kept her mind on the job and she doesn’t really deserve such an honour.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Its the end of the year and the school needs tidying up. Paulie is dragging his feet at the thought of having to sort everything out - hed rather carry on playing! But when Medhi tells them that theyre going to send the equipment thats still in good condition to a school at the end of the world that lacks everything, what used to be a chore turns into an exciting task! The children are going to put all their heart and soul into the success of this wonderful undertaking!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave bake a carrot cake for the Little Bunnies to help them say thank you to their Mom on Mother’s Day, for being such a great Mom. Following Hatty’s special recipe they seek out all the right ingredients, check the quantities they need and mix them all up in Hatty’s magic hat to make the perfect bake!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who can help Sketchy jump much further! Doodleboo explains how to draw a Kangaroo.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the Amazon Rainforest, Peyo discovers Black Caiman hatchlings trapped in a mound. In the garden, Leo and Katie are having a race while balancing a ping-pong ball on a spoon, Leo going really fast while Katie is slow and steadying. They get a call from Peyo who alerts them of the eggs which prompts a research on the computer. The rangers learn about the apex predators and their nesting habits, advising Peyo to leave the area but Peyo is already on a rock and worries about bumping into the mother. They fly to aid Peyo and wait for the mother but Hero spots the mother black caiman with a bucket on her head, Leo and Hero rescue her, ensuring her safe return to the nest. Later, as the mother tends to her hatchlings and Leo saves one hatchling almost falling off a rock edge. Back at the garden, Katie and Hero continue the spoon race.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The Firefly helps them, and with the assistance of the Moon, they swing on the Moon rocker seesaw. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma watch the fireworks at Bings house. Sula doesnt like the loud bangs, so she wears ear mufflers. Bing, on the other hand, thinks he is brave enough to watch the fireworks from the garden. All of a sudden, a very loud bang sends Bing running into the house and hiding under the kitchen table. Flop makes special ear gloves for Bing to enjoy the fireworks show without having to hear the loud bangs.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you break a special thing, you can put it in the bye-bye box and it keeps it safe.Bing is having fun with a new orange balloon when he jumps on it and breaks it. Bing is upset because he broke his balloon, so Flop helps him place the recovered pieces in the bye-bye box, which contains irreparable objects that are too valuable to throw away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is on the swing in the park when Pando arrives and wants to have a go too. They agree to let each other have turns by counting up to ten, but Pando wont count properly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Apple isnt paying attention when Strawberry describes their campout tradition of telling Tall Tales. So Apple tells her thrilling adventure of a wild road rally she entered, only to surprise the girls by proving the story is actually true.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Today, everybody seems to be squabbling: Edmund and Margaret, Biva and Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy! Nothing serious really, if you apologize. But as Scoutbadger and Woodsy obstinately refuse to do so, their fight becomes unbearable for their sister Berry.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse discover creatures that can blend in with their surroundings and are inspired to learn just where they can blend in. Little Nutbrown hare becomes disappointed when his white fluffy tail and his dark brown ear tips give him away each time. That’s until he discovers the reeds by the river are exactly the right height and colours to camouflage him perfectly.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare has a lot to do today. Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse promise to help but there are so many wonderful distractions they forget their promise and let Big Nutbrown Hare down. Luckily they learn a valuable lesson from some bees and get busy to make to things right!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble catches a cold, and Dr. Owl suggests drinking elderflower tea. Flutter sets out to gather elderflowers and meets Harmony, the glass-winged butterfly. Harmony teaches Flutter how to make the tea properly. Thanks to the delicious drink, Bubble soon recovers, and they celebrate spring with their new friend Harmony over a tasty elderflower syrup.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: In the courtyard, Sam and Julia have discovered that snowflakes are formed by beautiful little stars. But how can they preserve these wonders and show them to Julias mom before it melt?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have adopted a pumpkin theyve nicknamed Leo. But Sams dad is planning to make with it a delicious soup for the whole building. The two friends try anything they can to save him.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The wind is blowing on the beach while the Triplets are really excited at the thought of trying their brand new kite. But because of the wind ziouuuff the three sun hats fly away and go into the sea. The children don’t know what to do and look for a way to get their hats back. But by the way, where are going all the items which fly away?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The boys and Kiko are making a football field to play on the beach, all they need is a fourth player to make two teams. They ask Girl who was picking up shells on the beach. She happily accepts their offer but once the field’s ready, and with no explication at all, Girl starts sulking on her towel and refuse to talk to the boys. Nothing will make her stop, not pulling faces, not Mommies’ hugs, not even candies! What could have possibly happen?

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Chuggington is left in the dark when the lighthouse mysteriously stops working.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Norman and new boy Peter get lost at sea, Krystyna must pilot the new rescue plane and save them before their ship sinks!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Peter fixes Joe’s giant kite and gets it off the ground… unfortunately he also gets his feet tangled up in the string and is pulled into the air!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: When Kate can’t jump high enough to retrieve a ball stuck in a tree, she wonders what it would be like to have superpowers. In Mimiloo, Tack’s new Supercharger invention gives everyone superpowers! But their new abilities aren’t enough to get Boomer out of a bouncy predicament.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate can’t get the timing right to jump rope. In Mimiloo, Gobble has a case of the sneezy snorts and needs boom chicka bee honey tea to feel better. In order to get the honey, Kate must lead her friends to find the beat and make the most beautiful music the bees have ever heard.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou feels frustrated when Rosie solves all the scavenger hunt clues at Grandma and Grandpa’s beach house. In fantasy, Caillou pretends to be a pirate captain on a sinking ship who learns the importance of listening to his team.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou doesn’t like Daddy’s chicken dinner, and he says so with a “Yuck!” Going into fantasy, Caillou pretends to be the Silver Knight, cooking a meal for a very picky King (Daddy), and the experience teaches him to express his dislike for something in a more polite way.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas loves to race against Max and Monty, the cheeky dumper trucks. But, after one near accident too many, he decides he must ignore them if he wants to get on and be Useful. But, without Thomas to race against, Max and Monty muck about at the building site and Oliver is damaged. Then they race against the other construction vehicles, to see who can get their work done quickest. Rather than driving all the way to the dump, Max and Monty chuck all their building debris over a wall… not realising that the rubble is blocking Thomas’s branch line! When Thomas returns with Oliver, he ploughs into the pile of dirt and rocks and is derailed. So Max and Monty have to stay up all night clearing the line!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers teach a city Lyrebird - who can only mimic dreadful man-made sounds - the beautiful song of nature to help him blend in with wild Lyrebirds better. But is it so bad to be different?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Its movie night! But first, the Junior Rangers have to teach a Binturong how to climb trees.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pats delivering new rollers to the car wash but a broken catch on the van leads to chaos.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: The kids and Lauren have gone on a camping trip, but they have forgotten the tent.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Coco’s Hula Hoop. It’s harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset that she can’t hula anymore until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop teaches Bing and Pando how to blow bubbles. Bing finally blows a big bubble but gets upset when Pando pops it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula head off for a picnic at the paddling pool with Flop. But when they get there, they are shocked to find there is no water inside. Bing’s disappointment soon gives way to the realisation that it’s a very special pool day. With no water there are all sorts of games they can play that are usually against the pool rules.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Henry is taking a special picture of the gang in front of Big City’s geyser. While waiting around for their picture to be taken they decide to play a ball game but Weenie gets all covered in mud! Oswald tries to give Weenie a bath, but she doesn’t want to take one. After chasing her around Big City and getting himself and his friend all wet in the process, Oswald finally manages to get Weenie clean again and everyone has their picture taken.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald volunteers to make a special birthday cake for Catrina’s birthday party. Madame Butterfly says that all Catrina needs is a small simple cake. However, Oswald ends up making a huge birthday cake, eight tiers in total, with a tiny cupcake on top. After a collision with the Egg twins en route to the party Oswald ends up with just the cupcake – perfect for baby Catrina!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are completing work on a brand new fitness trail in the sports stadium park. They must finish before the afternoon’s Spring City Fun Run - a steeplechase across the fitness trail obstacle course, organised by Scoop’s idol Skye Sampson, a fitness guru and world champion record-breaking athlete. When Scoop is told that only humans will be competing, he sets up his own competition: the Muscle Machine Games! With events including “Weightlifting” (with a pallet of wooden beams) and “Discuss Throw” (with an old tyre) Lofty and Muck both break new records...

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has arranged for Ballroom Blitz, TV dance sensation, to come on tour to Spring City. When star dancer, Sylvain de Souza, threatens to cancel the show unless he gets a sprung dance floor, Maria enlists Bob to save the day, in return for a show tango with her hero. Dance fever sweeps Team Bob and the Spring City Rockets but Lofty despairs of ever being able to dance as well as the others. Just as he finds his dancing mojo, Lofty accidentally wrecks part of the sprung dance floor. Sylvain recognizes a kindred spirit in Lofty and urges him to follow his dreams, no matter how unlikely they may seem.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare follows some unusual tracks in the snow that eventually lead him to a shy little spotty deer. He plays with his new friend every day, until she has to leave again with her mother to search for food. Little Nutbrown Hare is sad to see her go, but he’s also glad that he has friends that stay in the meadow all year round.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class is having a picnic and everyone is happy. Especially Paxton! Learn about healthy snacks with Otus, Stripey and Yabba.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle, Lowly and Sally find a lost bag, they use the eyeglass case, atomizer, map, and a red scarf inside it to determine that the owner is a famous international opera star who’s come to Busytown to perform for the first time./Cyclists getting flat tires somewhere in Busytown lead Huckle and the gang on a mystery.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is surrounded by his usual mess! Hopping about, he asks himself why fish live underwater, but birds live in trees? When you need to know go to Okido! Messy lands with a somersault onto his bottom and finds Felix and Zoe are painting their house. “Why?” asks Messy. “You have to take care of the place you live in Messy”, explains Zoe. And just at that moment an alarm goes off… It’s a Cloudship emergency!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is trying to fly, and doesn’t understand why he can’t. So he jumps into the vortex to go to Okido and find out! When Messy bounces off the trampoline in Okido he flaps his little arms to turn the bounce into flying but he lands with a bump onto his bottom! Zoe and Felix laugh at him for trying to fly, and tell him to go with them to hear Mayor Oki’s AMAZING news. Messy loves anything amazing, so they skidoodle on down to Okido Park.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: At the girls campout, Sour launches into a whopper of a yarn about the adventures she and Sweet had in the Berry Deep Dark Forest. She tries to get Sweet to participate in spinning the tale, but Sours over-the-top performance leaves Sweet behind. Toward the end, Sour graciously changes the story to pull Sweet into it, giving Sweet the opportunity to toss in an ad lib that makes a nice topper to Sours story. Sweet is thrilled when everyone applauds her, even Sour, who is impressed by her contribution and proud of her sister.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is disappointed that none of his wishes come true in the real world, the dinosaurs take him to visit the wishing well.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry, Charlie, and the dinosaurs are playing at being pirates.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden is about to take a bite of his peanut butter sandwich before things take an unexpected turn when a crafty raccoon snatches his comms device. Simultaneously, Leo and Katie engage in a decluttering activity in the garden, pondering which possessions to keep or give away. They receive a call from Jayden but instead of seeing Jayden on the screen, it’s the raccoon on the run! Confused, this prompts the Junior Rangers swift response. They arrive and meet with a tired and lost Jayden who shows them the direction the raccoon went. This leads them near a road where the raccoon runs in the middle of it, which raises the rangers’ concerns about relocating the raccoon. They meet up with Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey to provide insights into raccoon behavior and habits. Jaydens ingenious use of a peanut butter and jelly sandwich to bait the raccoon into giving back the comms device works but Ranger Rocky intervenes and reminds them not to feed wildlife but the raccoon scurries off. The day concludes with a successful mission and Leo, Katie and Hero continue with sorting their stuff and Hero lets go of his unused toy.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When some of the engines think life would be easier without Diesel, he decides to teach them a lesson by hiding. But his plan backfires when none of the engines come looking for him! Diesel is painted with glow-in-the-dark paint and he plays a trick on the other engines... but Nia and Paxton surprise him in return!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Shane is having too much fun to stop and refuel; that is, until he runs out of coal and is stranded in the hot, red desert.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu is entrusted with what seems to be an easy mission. It consists in moving a beehive in a field of honey flowers. But things get complicated when an accident occurs, and the beehive gets lost. Moreover, Grisu has to deal with Fume who has a sore throat and cannot spit fire. Grisu will finally succeed in getting the bee queen (and the other bees) into the beehive thanks to Miss Gertruds perfume. And Fume will be cured thanks to the honey!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Natureza is on the ice cap conducting a polar bear study. She still has one last bear to tag but its too fast. So she needs a snowmobile pilot to help her approach and tag the beast. Its a perfect mission for Grisu who is no snowmobile pilot, but can adapt to anything and is impervious to cold! As he lands on the polar cap, Grisu unwittingly wakes up the napping bear and is chased after by it. He gets out of his bind thanks to Natureza. As theyre getting ready to tag the bear, Grisu, unwittingly again, burns the snowmobile engine. The mission seems compromised, but a firefighter never gives up! Resourceful Grisu uses his wind-filled parachute to pull the snowmobile and thanks to him, Natureza ends up tagging the bear.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A fun, spooky tale from little White Owl leaves the friends a little on edge, so when they hear strange noises in the pumpkin patch, they wonder what kind of creepy creature might be lurking there with them. Will Big Nutbrown Hare be able to convince them not to let their imaginations run away with them?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The friends are all playing together in the Autumn meadow. Little Redwood Fox inadvertently spoils all the games of the day, but the others put their heads together and come up with a game that suits her perfectly.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: This badge is a little different. The trainees must award this badge to someone they appreciate. Brewster finds it difficult, as he appreciates so many of his friends for so many different reasons. In the end, he decides to award it Vee, who always keeps an eye out for him, encourages him to do his best - and keeps Chuggington running like clockwork!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger has made a bet with Pico that his father, Edmund, who never gives the children any lessons, will be there tomorrow. He has, of course, been a little hasty as, for Edmund, this is out of the question.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are preparing to dig the foundations for a skyscraper in Spring City’s new business zone and are under pressure from Mayor Madison to get started. She keeps interrupting their work on Bob’s smart-phone. Scoop and Muck set a challenge to see which of them can dig/clear the earth quickest. Interrupted again, Bob calls a halt but the machines get carried away and keep digging. Scoop goes too deep and hits into something hard underground. Bob calls Anish Bose, the archaeologist, who announces the discovery of Roman ruins. The build will have to halt while they excavate the site. Scoop is filled with remorse and horrified to learn that Romans didn’t have machines like him. An interested crowd starts to gather as Anish discovers more artefacts. Mr Bentley arrives for a progress report but rather than being angry at the lack of progress he is excited by the historic discovery.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It’s Christmas time. Bob and the team are building the Spring City Christmas display in the city centre’s plaza. Lofty loves everything Christmas and decorates the yard in snowflakes. Then he sees that Bob’s home doesn’t have any decorations, so he decides to give him the perfect present. Lofty arrives on site, determined to give Bob his Christmas present but when asked to help hang the lights, he puts the present down by the giant display tree. Lofty finishes his work and again tries to give Bob his present but now it’s lost somewhere in the display.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Something knocks Sgt. Murphy’s hat off his head, chops the tops of Baker Humperdink’s baguettes, and sheers a path through a flower bed. Although no one saw anything, they all heard it make the same whoop whoop whoop sound. Putting the clues together, Huckle, Sally and Lowly figure out that it was Vanderbuilt’s new, out of control, boomerang./The mysterious disappearance of Mayor Fox leaves Huckle and the gang on an important search.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo, Katie and Hero get to know a feathery new friend—an Indian peacock! They bring the peacock to the rainforest to look for peahens, but end up crossing paths with two jungle cats.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A trip to the rainforest becomes necessary when a clouded leopard cub turns up in the garden. The Junior Rangers search for the cub’s mother, but are set back when the cub gets entangled in some tree vines above water.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: While playing soccer, Simon and Gaspard send the soccer ball flying into the hollow tree. Simon crawls inside to get it and when he does, he comes face to face with a hedgehog. He’s sooooo cute that Simon and Gaspard decide to take him home. Since his quills are prickly they decide to call him...Prickly! They put on gloves to carry him. But once in the house, they run into daddy who explains to them that wild animals should be left in the hands of mother nature. So the boys take him out into the yard. But Prickly makes a quick bee-line back into the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 01 Mepe
programme.desc: The characters in the Berry and Dolly stories are a bunch of tiny bugs and beetles who live alongside one another in the forest. The stories are lead by the title characters: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird. A variety of other characters join them in their fun and games throughout the series with the stories set in their forest home. All the characters’ houses, belongings and clothes perfectly match their individual appearance.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 01 Mepe 1007 - Christmas
programme.desc: The characters in the Berry and Dolly stories are a bunch of tiny bugs and beetles who live alongside one another in the forest. The stories are lead by the title characters: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird. A variety of other characters join them in their fun and games throughout the series with the stories set in their forest home. All the characters’ houses, belongings and clothes perfectly match their individual appearance.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It turns out whether there are witches or not, and that it is not nice to frighten others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly goes to the kindergarten and the day passes fast with lot of interesting plays.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar really gets to like the unknown bumblebee girl, and with the help of the friends he even builds a house for her.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly accidentally ruin the snowman of Balthazar but finally they build an even nicer one jointly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Pando and me did music all together.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are playing a vooshing game with their favourite toys, Hoppity Voosh and Hippo Fairy. They throw them into the air to see how high they can fly – Voooooosh! Uh-oh…Sula’s hippo gets stuck in a tree so Bing throws Hoppity up to save her, only for Hoppity to get stuck too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are playing outside in the cold, blowing steamy dragon breath at each other and discovering icicles hanging from the tap. Flop makes hot chocolate to warm everybody up but Bing can’t wait for it to cool down before he can drink it and burns his fingers – Pando’s quick thinking brings the icicle to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesn’t want to play any of the games Bing has put out. Bing is upset until Flop suggests they watch to see what Charlie really wants to do. Charlie heads straight for the kitchen where he, and Bing, have a great time making music with pots and pans.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: A new kind of biscuit has been delivered to the village shop and Molly would dearly love to know how they taste. Under Tildas alarmed gaze, she climbs up the counter on which the biscuit tin is standing, climbs inside – and when a gust of wind blows the lid shut, cant get out again. Horrified, Tilda rushes off to get help from Rupert.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly stands trembling at Tildas door: last night she heard noises in the village shop and then found an empty tin can. Its bound to have been a hungry ghost making trouble! That night, Tilda, Rupert, Molly and Edna lie in wait in the village shop to catch the ghost red-handed.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: A tiring gardening session make the friends of Wild Rose Lane dream of going away on holiday. But none of them wants to be all alone in far-off places. So Tilda suggests that they simply swap homes. No sooner said than done! Tilda moves in to Ednas, Molly to Ruperts, Robin to Tildas, the squirrels to Mollys and Rupert to Robins.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: At school, the kids are having a tug-of-war contest. Simon is teamed up with Sophie and Olivia and they lose against Ferdinand’s team. Simon complains, Ferdinand had the best team, it was unfair! And so Simon wants his revenge: a soccer game! And this time, he gets to play with Lou and Mamadou on his team! No problem for Ferdinand who knows that Olivia is a super good soccer player. The game begins and of course Olivia starts scoring goals. Rats, what a bummer, Ferdinand has the best team again!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A visit to the mangrove swamp is in order when Leo and Hero find a baby estuarine crocodile in the garden. Can the Junior Rangers find the baby crocodile’s nest while avoiding the adult crocodiles that roam the swamp?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees must compare loads to determine which are heavier and which are lighter. It looks like Brewster’s got it wrong when he says his second load is heavier than his first – the loads weight exactly the same. But then a stowaway is discovered in the second load - Peckham! It turns out Brewster was right after all – Peckham’s added weight means the second load was heavier!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, Koko and Brewster have to wash some dirty cars using the Chugwash. Koko will bring the cars to Brewster, who will put them through the wash. Koko is impatient and delivers the cars too quickly. Brewster is overly careful about washing them and goes too slowly, getting behind. They both realise their mistakes and work as a team to get the job done properly.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are excited to be looking after a guest - a friend’s unique rooster by the name of Rigoletto. They ask Fred what makes it so unique but he’s not sure; all he knows is that they need to take good care of it. However, despite being housed in its very own enclosure, Rigoletto escapes and goes missing!! Huh! Maybe the animal’s uniqueness will allow the kids to track it down…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Ciboulette the cat has stolen Fanni’s plush toy, making the little girl extremely sad. T’choupi and Nina are determined to get the toy back but the cat refuses to comply! After several vain attempts at approaching Ciboulette, the two friends receive unexpected assistance… from the chickens!.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today is picnic in the forest day! And T’choupi and his friends are going to be riding there on their bicycles. Yay, how exciting!... Except, for some reason, Nina doesn’t seem too enthusiastic about it… That’s strange – what could possibly be the matter?: she loves going to the forest and is always up for adventure! She agrees to go in the end, albeit reluctantly. But before long, T’choupi discovers her shameful secret…

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley is worried because a nanny he doesnt know is coming to pick him up. Luckily, the new nanny - Emilie - is really nice! The next day, its Bens turn to be worried because this evening, its a nanny he doesnt know whos coming to pick him up too. Until the boys discover that its... Emilie! Charley grimaces: he cant believe his eyes!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Tonight there is a children show for the parents. Julia planned a scooter act with Sam. But Sam doesnt dare to tell her he is very bad on those wheels. How long can he avoid to tell her the truth?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: To help his little brother Ben feel less frustrated by his young age, Sam decided to help him. Together with Julia, they try to come up with a good scheme to make him feel like a hero.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have decided to play doctors to help their friends stuffed animals and heal dolls hurts. Dr. Julia and Sam, her nurse, pay visits to some of them in the Mouse Mansion.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A delivery of pipes is being unloaded at Brendam Docks. But the engines start to hear scary spooky noises and soon Salty has them all convinced that it’s the sound of the Flatbeds of Fear. Only Emily insists that there must be a sensible explanation, until she hears the sound herself and gets frightened. But it turns out Emily was right about their being a sensible explanation. The sound was just air blowing over the pipes!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Paxton likes to be friends with everyone, diesels and steamies alike, but it’s not easy to be friends with Diesel. Diesel gives Paxton a terrible fright when he makes him think that all the other diesels have disappeared. He hides and races away from Paxton. But when Diesel runs out of fuel, it is Paxton who takes him by surprise by offering him help. Paxton gives him a push to the fuel tank, and a taste of what friendship might be like.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou shares a story about his first time going skiing.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou helps Daddy with grown-up work on Take Your Kid to Work Day!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: A mysterious giant circle appears in the middle of a corn field. Although Pig Will and Pig Won’t are convinced it’s the landing site of an alien flying saucer, Huckle puts the clues together and ultimately goes up in a hot air balloon to reveal the flattened area is actually Vincent Van Goat’s latest artistic endeavor./When flying potatoes are dropping from the sky in Busytown, Huckle and gang are determined to find out why.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Ever tried making a hay tower? Well Monkey did only not very successfully and when it was time to clean things up he got some unexpected help from his friend the horse. Horse was eager to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey wants to build himself a new house, when the first try doesnt end well he decides to use rocks. To his big surprise one of these rocks turns out to be no other then his friend Turtle! Well, a visit from a friend is always a good reason to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
